column4: hello, I'm a 62 year old retired police dispatcher from alabama, and my grandson told me about your ubuntu system so I got it loaded up on my computer. I did it all myself, just about, now I just can't get my screens set up quite right. My grandson said there was some community on this chat that could help me get it fixed up.
But this time I am using Gaim.
this is the same place, okay. should I re-explain my problem?
well yes, and here's the thing...
the system seems to act like I have another monitor... except that the other monitor now shows up all fuzzy and distorted, and when I move the mouse over there it's just a big square.
see, I tried to manually rewrite the xorg.conf file for myself, and I must have broken it up somewhere in there.
move it to /etc/X11/xorg.conf.old for example and start 'sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg'
and try inserting the right specifications for your monitor in that..
when I do that, it's going to put it back in "Clone" mode, isn't it?
not sure what you mean with the 'clone mode'
it displays the same thing on both screens, and puts both screens in 640x480. Maybe it's safe mode.
there is physically one monitor in which two screens appear?
well, for the quite common configurations it is.. xinerama however is less used and therefore less bug-free
sorry what was the command you told me to run after moving my xorg.conf?
